bibl.title: Jeremiah Mangan v. John H. McGraw. Judge Statement
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.p:
In the District Court, holding terms at Seattle
In the matter of the application of Jeremiah Order Mangan for a writ of Habeas Corpus
In marking and filing the petition of Jeremiah Mangan, duly signed and verified by him, whereby in offense that he is i llegally imprisoned and restrained of his liberty by one John H. McGraw Sheriff of King County, W. T., in the County Jail of said County, and stating where said illegality consists, from which it appears to me that a writ of Habeas Corpus aught to issue, it is ordered That a writ of Habeas Corpus issue out of and under The issue of The above entitled writ directed to the said John H. McGraw, commanding him to have the body of the said Jeremiah Mangan before me at the chambers Court Room of said Court on the 27th day of May A. D. 1889 at 44, o'clock P. M., to do and retrieve what shall then and there be considered concerning the said Jeremiah Mangan together with the time and cause of his detention, and that he have then and there said writ Dated on the 25th day of May A. D. 1889 C. H. Hanford Judge

A-374 E 6867 T Application of J. Mangan for writ of Habeas Corpus.
Order
FILED MAY 27 1889 R M Hopkins Clerk. By H T Hannon Deputy Clerk.
